instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message:
Hi on this board I have quarter fan spin, checked already
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 - right values at 10 ohm
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> - 2.5 ohms
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> - 0.2 ohms

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.63v but goes low to 12.0v and when it goes up again, the fan tries to start... any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2click, post: 67060, member: 24760"]
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 - right values at 10 ohm
[/QUOTE]
You mean itâ€™s 10ohm each or between them? Resistance between pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> should be 20ohm. Are big coils on the board pulsing while quarter fan spin?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message: Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message: I tried SMC bypass, no luck, still getting quarter spin, no orange light when the battery is connected... I reballed the SMC, nothing... doing the same... what else to check? Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message:
Did you try original 60/85W charger?
What about lab PSU?

You didn't reply to the questions from a previous post...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message:
Using original 85 watt magsafe charger...
Its 10 ohms each, between them it is 20.7 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message: Remove F7040 and check if voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> is steady 12.5V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message: Removed F7040 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was 12.34v and going slowly up. It took around 5 minutes to get to 12.56v the strange this is that it is still going up slowly... it got to 12.61v and going slowly up... I disconnected the magsafe...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B QUARTER FAN SPIN
threads.message:
So you have a problem on the charger side.
Keep F7040 out, untill get stable voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR>.

Post exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
